overview: From 2025-11-10 to 2025-11-11, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 10 new PRs (7 merged), 0 new issues, and 26 active contributors.

topPRs.title: fix(contracts-script): adds support for zstd scripts
topPRs.author: serpixel
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**
Adds zstd support for contracts scripts. These will be uploaded by default in both formats, eventually we should stick with zstd as the improvement is 95% fold.
`Size comparison: .tar.gz=405.93MB, .tar.zst=16.85MB (95% smaller)`

topPRs.title: cannon-kona: Add support for building a kona prestate and using it in dev stack tests.
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Adds a just file to build a particular Kona-client version. While the build can take 5-10 minutes we can leverage CircleCI caching to avoid building it when we haven't changed anything about the build process. Additionally it's designed so that the hash is provided to configure games but the prestate itself doesn't have to be available unless tests actually use it (which non currently do). So we're testing the contract deployment for cannon-kona and providing valid inputs, but not challenger's ability to actually execute that prestate.

 Currently only interop tests are setting the cannon-kona prestate, but we build both variants.

**Tests**

topPRs.title: op-e2e: Remove support for L2OO withdrawals
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

op-e2e hasn't had a configuration that used L2OO for a long time so remove the code paths to perform withdrawals pre-fault proofs.

topPRs.title: fix(op-service): replace string-based error matching with errors.Is
topPRs.author: saintparish4
topPRs.body:
## Description
Replaces string-based error matching with Go's `errors.Is()` for proper error type checking in the transaction resubmitter.

Addresses TODO(13408) on line 107-108 of `op-service/txinclude/resubmitter.go`.

## Motivation
- **Performance**: `errors.Is()` is faster than string comparison
- **Correctness**: Properly handles wrapped errors (Go 1.13+ convention)
- **Maintainability**: Survives error message changes
- **Best Practice**: Aligns with Go error handling conventions

## Changes
- Replaced `strings.Contains(err.Error(), recognizedErr.Error())` with `errors.Is(err, recognizedErr)`
- Removed `strings` import as it's no longer needed
- Added comprehensive tests for wrapped errors, deeply nested errors, and unknown errors
- Updated function documentation to explain the improvement

## Related Issue
Fixes TODO(13408)

## Additional Notes
This is my first contribution to Optimism. I understand this may be considered a small change, but I wanted to learn the contribution process and address a legitimate technical improvement. Happy to expand this PR or take on additional tasks based on maintainer feedback.

topPRs.title: cannon: Fix shutdown process to ensure preimage server channels are closed
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

kona-host wasn't exiting when the client program completed leaving cannon hung forever. Closing the file channels sends a signal it actually listens to so it exits. Also strengthen the fallbacks to ultimately terminate the subprocess forcefully if it ignores even the KILL signal.

The cannon-kona AT is still failing because it doesn't support ws URLs (needs https://github.com/op-rs/kona/pull/3022 and then pull in a new kona version in kona/justfile).

**Metadata**

https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/17764
